description: From Middle English porcioun, borrowed from Old French porcion, from Latin portio (“a share, part, portion, relation, proportion”), akin to pars (“part”); see part. Compare proportion.

entries.meaning: That which is divided off or separated, as a part from a whole; a separated part of anything.

examples: Man's portion is to die and rise again.

entries.meaning: The part of an estate given or falling to a child or heir; an inheritance.

verbs.description: portion (third-person singular simple present portions, present participle portioning, simple past and past participle portioned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To divide into amounts, as for allocation to specific purposes.
(transitive) To endow with a portion or inheritance.
examples: Him portioned maids, apprenticed orphans, blest.
